title: Looking for Helvetica metal type
content:
I'm looking to purchase some metal type Helvetica, 48pt or larger. Maybe 100 characters total, doesn't really matter if they're not complete alphabets or anything.

Anyone have any? Or know a good place to find some?

Cheers,

-Gary
author: swiss dots

comments.content: I would look at [http://www.briarpress.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110326181423/http:/www.briarpress.com/ "http://www.briarpress.com/") in the classifieds. I'm sure if you posted this same request there, you'd get a few responses. There's also a LETPRESS group over at yahoo groups and you could ask there as well. Can't wait for the movie! --jimmy
Get in contact with Georg Kraus at [www.bleisetzer.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20110326181423/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/ "www.bleisetzer.de"), maybe he can help you.

I am dealer of used letterpress types.  
And I offer e.g. Helvetica:

[http://www.bleisetzer.de/index.php?target=verkauf](http://web.archive.org/web/20110326181423/http:/www.bleisetzer.de/index.php?target=verkauf "http://www.bleisetzer.de/index.php?target=verkauf")

And I am dealer for Stempel, so I can offer new Helvetica weights.  
But not '100 characters' but complete fonts. But this is not cheap.  
For the new types you have to calculate from 48 p  
1 kg - approx. 75 Euro

And it can be shipped in anglo-american heigt.

The used ones are much more cheaper, but with a german height.

Regards,  
Georg
